text:
yoooo <@U06DFL7BP> 
had a chat w/ leia about ASC aliasing. here’s the plan she came up with.

ASC wants to have an email landing page at somewhere like `<http://mobilemuseum.azscience.org|mobilemuseum.azscience.org>` resolve to `<http://cs.uncorkedstudios.com|cs.uncorkedstudios.com>`

to achieve this they must add a new CNAME resource to their DNS for a new subdomain.
i imagine they have the option of setting a TTL which they should either leave at the defult for their setup, or set to 1hr.

So, example:
```
alias domain: mobilemuseum
CNAME: <http://cs.uncorkedstudios.com|cs.uncorkedstudios.com>
TTL: default/1hr
```

[alias domain being their new subdomain for the landing page]

<@U1S5GKTHQ> correct me if i’m wrong
i’m new to this stuff
i’ll forward on, that all sounds right.
